newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian prison guards threaten strike.
newsitem.headline: Colombian prison guards threaten strike.

text.p: Colombia's prison guards could go on strike from next Monday because the government has ordered police to take control of the country's top-security jails, a union leader said on Wednesday.

"We will not allow our working rights to be violated. If police take control of the compounds then we will be forced to launch a strike," Neftali Reyes, leader of the prison guards' union, told reporters.
Justice Minister Carlos Medellin ordered police into the nation's four maximum-security prisons after a series of riots and scandals.

In the space of less than a week, 2,000 inmates, led by convicted leftist guerrillas, went on a 36-hour rampage and started fires in Bogota's La Modelo prison. A prisoner in the capital's other top-security jail, la Picota, was killed when a bomb he was preparing exploded.

Reyes did not outline exactly what form the strike would take. During past work actions, the union has prevented new prisoners from entering the jails and refused to let inmates out for court appearances.
